basic.floral_language:
Jacaranda mimosifolia
Floriography: serenity, graceful, warm
Jacaranda belongs to deciduous trees. Small oval leaves. Blue flowers. Flowers are inverted bell-shaped, slightly drooping. Flowers are all over the tree, giving the quiet and peaceful look. Usually used to decorate the gardens, parks, or made into bonsai indoor landscaping.
Jacaranda likes abundance of sunshine, doing ok in slightly shade. Blooming in May and June, lasting for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-June, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, slight shade tolerance
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
